Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA 2.3 means the CSA standard ANSI Z21.47-2001/CSA 2.3-2001 entitled Gas-Fired Central Furnaces. (CSA 2.3)
CSA P.2 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.2-13 entitled Testing Method for Measuring the Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency of Residential Gas-Fired or Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA P.2)

gas furnace means an automatic operating gas-fired central forced air furnace that uses propane or natural gas and has an input rate of not more than 117.23 kW (400,000 Btu/h). It does not include a furnace for a mobile home or for a recreational vehicle. (générateur d’air chaud à gaz)
through-the-wall means, with respect to a gas furnace, one that is designed and marketed to be installed in an opening in an exterior wall that is fitted with a weatherized sleeve. (mural)

Subsection.Text: A gas furnace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 259, a gas furnace is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to gas furnaces described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A gas furnace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a gas furnace as defined in section 257.

row.entry: Gas furnaces that have an input rate of ≤ 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h) and use single-phase electric current
On or after February 3, 1995 and before December 31, 2009
Gas furnaces that have an input rate of ≤ 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h), use single-phase electric current and do not have an integrated cooling component
Gas furnaces that are outdoor furnaces, have an input rate of ≤ 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h), use single-phase electric current and have an integrated cooling component
Gas furnaces that are through-the-wall, have an input rate of ≤ 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h), use single-phase electric current and have an integrated cooling component
On or after December 31, 2009 and before December 31, 2012

Gas furnaces that have an input rate of ≤ 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h) and use three-phase electric current
Gas furnaces that have an input rate of > 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h) but ≤ 117.23 kW (400,000 Btu/h)

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas furnace described in column 1.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B212 means the CSA standard CSA-B212-93 entitled Seasonal Energy Utilization Efficiencies of Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA B212)
oil-fired furnace means a warm-air furnace, other than a furnace for a mobile home or for a recreational vehicle, that has an input rate of not more than 65.92 kW (225,000 Btu/h) and that is either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exclusively oil-fired; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: capable of being fired, at the choice of the user, by either oil or another fuel. (générateur d’air chaud à mazout)

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired furnace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 263, an oil-fired furnace is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.
The energy efficiency standard that applies to an oil-fired furnace is that its seasonal energy utilization efficiency must be greater than or equal to 78%.

An oil-fired furnace complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA B212 that are applicable to an oil-fired furnace as defined in section 261.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA B212 and provided to the Minister in respect of an oil-fired furnace:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its input rate, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its seasonal energy utilization efficiency.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.4.1 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA P.4.1-02 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fireplace Efficiency. (CSA P.4.1)
CSA P.4.1-15 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA P.4.1-15 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fireplace Efficiency. (CSA P.4.1-15)
gas fireplace means a vented gas fireplace or a vented gas fireplace heater, as described in CSA P.4.1-15, that is fuelled by natural gas or propane. (foyer à gaz)

Subsection.Text: A gas fireplace is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 7, a gas fireplace is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after June 1, 2003.
For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a gas fireplace:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of fuel it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum and minimum input rates, expressed in kilowatts (British thermal units per hour);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the fireplace efficiency;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether it is freestanding, zero-clearance or an insert;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the type of ignition system it has, namely, standing pilot, intermittent ignition device, on-demand pilot or remotely operated pilot; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the venting configuration the product has, namely, natural venting, direct venting or powered venting.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA P.4.1, if the product was manufactured on or after June 1, 2003 and before January 1, 2017; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA P.4.1-15, if the product is manufactured on or after January 1, 2017.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.11 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.11-07 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Efficiency and Energy Consumption of Gas-fired Unit Heaters. (CSA P.11)

gas-fired unit heater means a self-contained, automatically controlled, vented, gas-burning appliance that distributes warmed air without the use of ducts and that has an input rate of not more than 2 931 kW (10,000,000 Btu/h). (aérotherme à gaz)

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired unit heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 270, a gas-fired unit-heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after August 8, 2008.
The following energy efficiency standards apply to a gas-fired unit heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its thermal efficiency must be at least 80% at the maximum heat input nominal capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it must be equipped with an intermittent ignition device and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a power-vented system,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an automatic vent damper, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an automatic flue damper.

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired unit heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA P.11 that are applicable to a gas-fired unit heater as defined in section 268.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA P.11 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas-fired unit heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of fuel it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of ignition system it has;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the venting configuration it has, namely, a power-vented system, an automatic vent damper or an automatic flue damper;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum heat input and output nominal capacities, expressed in kilowatts;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its thermal efficiency when at the maximum heat input nominal capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its electricity consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours, when at the maximum nominal heat input capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if it is a modulating or staged control gas-fired unit heater,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its reduced heat input and output nominal capacities, expressed in kilowatts, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its electricity consumption, expressed in kilowatt hours, when at reduced heat input nominal capacity.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: ASHRAE 103 means the ANSI/ASHRAE standard 103-2007 entitled Method of Testing for Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency of Residential Central Furnaces and Boilers. (ASHRAE 103)
automatic water temperature adjustment device means a device that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjusts the temperature of the water supplied by a boiler to ensure that an incremental change in inferred heat load produces a corresponding incremental change in the temperature of the water supplied or, if the boiler fires at a single input rate, automatically allows the burner or heating element to fire only when the device has determined that the inferred heat load cannot be met by the residual heat of the water in the system; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when there is no inferred heat load, limits the water temperature in the boiler to not more than 60°C. (dispositif automatique de réglage de la température de l’eau)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CGA P.2 means the CGA standard CGA P.2-1991 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiencies of Residential Furnaces and Boilers. (CGA P.2)
CSA P.2 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.2-07 entitled Testing Method for Measuring the Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency of Residential Gas-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA P.2)

gas boiler means a boiler that uses propane or natural gas, is intended for application in a low pressure steam, or hot water, central heating system and has an input rate of less than 88 kW (300,000 Btu/h). (chaudière à gaz)

Subsection.Text: A gas boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a gas boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 4, unless it is manufactured on or after June 30, 1999; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 317, unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to gas boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A gas boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a gas boiler as defined in section 315.

CSA P.2 for annual fuel utilization efficiency
Gas boilers that are intended for hot water systems

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas boiler described in column 1.

row.entry: Gas boilers manufactured on or after December 31, 1998 and before September 1, 2010

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: type of central heating system for which product is intended;

CSA P.2 for information set out in paragraphs (a) to (g)

Provision.Text: type of central heating system for which product is intended;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: maximum heat input and output nominal capacities, in kW;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: average annual electrical energy consumption (EAE), in kWh;

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: if the product is manufactured on or after September 1, 2012,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: information that indicates whether product has tankless domestic water heating coils, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: type of automatic water temperature adjustment device it has, if any.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B212 means the CSA standard CSA-B212-93 entitled Seasonal Energy Utilization Efficiencies of Oil-Fired Furnaces and Boilers. (CSA B212)
oil-fired boiler means a boiler that is intended for application in a low pressure steam, or hot water, central heating system, has an input rate of less than 88 kW (300,000 Btu/h) and is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exclusively oil-fired; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: capable of being fired, at the choice of the user, by either oil or another fuel. (chaudière à mazout)

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, an oil-fired boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 4, unless it is manufactured on or after June 30, 1999; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 321, unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1998.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to oil-fired boilers described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

An oil-fired boiler complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to an oil-fired boiler as defined in section 319.

row.entry: On or after December 31, 1998 and before September 1, 2010
Oil-fired boilers that are intended for low pressure steam systems
Oil-fired boilers that are intended for hot water systems
On or after September 1, 2010 and before September 1, 2012
Oil-fired boilers that are intended for hot water systems and have tankless domestic water heating coils
Oil-fired boilers that are intended for hot water systems and do not have tankless domestic water heating coils‍
ASHRAE 103 for annual fuel utilization efficiency

Provision.Text: Equipped with automatic water temperature adjustment device and not operable without the device

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of an oil-fired boiler described in column 1.

row.entry: Oil-fired boilers manufactured on or after December 31, 1998 and before September 1, 2010
Oil-fired boilers manufactured on or after September 1, 2010
ASHRAE 103 for information set out in paragraphs (a) to (f)

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: type of central heating system for which product is intended;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: maximum heat input and output nominal capacities, in kW (Btu/h);

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: average annual electrical energy consumption (EAE), in kWh;

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: if product is manufactured on or after September 1, 2012,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: information that indicates whether product has tankless domestic water heating coils, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: type of automatic water temperature adjustment device product has, if any.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, electric boiler means a boiler that uses electric energy as a source of heat, is intended for application in a hot water central heating system, has an input rate of less than 88 kW (300,000 Btu/h) and is not equipped with tankless domestic water heating coils.

Subsection.Text: An electric boiler is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 325, an electric boiler is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after September 1, 2012.

Section.Text: The energy efficiency standard that applies to an electric boiler is that it must be equipped with an automatic water temperature adjustment device without which the boiler is not operable.
For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of an electric boiler:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its input rate, expressed in kilowatts, collected in accordance with ASHRAE 103; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of automatic water temperature adjustment device that it has.

Section.Text: In this Division, Vr means the nominal volume, expressed in litres, of a water heater’s storage tank.
The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: bottom inlet means a cold water inlet, other than one with a dip tube, that enters near the bottom of the water heater’s storage tank. (entrée inférieure)
CSA C191-04 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C191-04 entitled Performance of Electric Storage Tank Water Heaters for Domestic Hot Water Service. (CSA C191-04)

electric water heater means a stationary electric storage tank water heater that is intended for use on a pressurized water system and has a Vr of at least 50 L (11 imperial gallons) but not more than 454 L (100 imperial gallons). (chauffe-eau électrique)

Subsection.Text: An electric water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 372, an electric water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to electric water heaters described in column 1.

An electric water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C191-04 that are applicable to an electric water heater as defined in section 370.

row.entry: Electric water heaters that have a bottom inlet and a Vr of ≥ 50 L but ≤ 270 L
Electric water heaters that have a bottom inlet and a Vr of > 270 L but ≤ 454 L
Electric water heaters that have a top inlet and a Vr of ≥ 50 L but ≤ 270 L
Electric water heaters that have a top inlet and a Vr of > 270 L but ≤ 454 L

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C191-04 and provided to the Minister in respect of an electric water heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its Vr;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nominal power input of its upper and lower elements, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its standby loss, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the cold water inlet configuration, namely, a top inlet or bottom inlet.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA P.3-04 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-P.3-04 entitled Testing Method for Measuring Energy Consumption and Determining Efficiencies of Gas-Fired Storage Water Heaters. (CSA P.3-04)
gas-fired storage water heater means a stationary gas-heated water container that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: uses propane or natural gas for fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has an input of not more than 21.97 kW (75,000 Btu/h); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a Vr of at least 76 L (20 US gallons) but not more than 380 L (100 US gallons). (chauffe-eau à réservoir alimenté au gaz)

Subsection.Text: A gas-fired storage water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 376, a gas-fired storage water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 1 of the table to this section apply to gas-fired storage water heaters that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 2.

A gas-fired storage water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA P.3-04 that are applicable to a gas-fired storage water heater as defined in section 374.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before December 31, 2016

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA P.3-04 and provided to the Minister in respect of a gas-fired storage water heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its Vr;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its input rate, expressed in kilowatts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its recovery efficiency;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its energy factor;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the fuel it uses;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its annual energy consumption, expressed in kilojoules; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: its first hour rating, expressed in litres.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA B211-00 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-B211-00 entitled Energy Efficiency of Oil-Fired Storage Tank Water Heaters. (CSA B211-00)

oil-fired water heater means a water heater that uses oil for fuel, and has an input rate of not more than 30.5 kW (105,000 Btu/h) and a Vr of at least 76 L (20 US gallons) but not more than 190 L (50 US gallons). (chauffe-eau à mazout)

Subsection.Text: An oil-fired water heater is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 380, an oil-fired water heater is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 1 of the table to this section apply to oil-fired water heaters that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 2.

An oil-fired water heater complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA B211-00 that are applicable to an oil-fired water heater as defined in section 378.

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before December 31, 2016

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA B211-00 and provided to the Minister in respect of an oil-fired water heater:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its Vr;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its input rate, expressed in kilowatts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its recovery efficiency;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its energy factor; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its first hour rating, expressed in litres.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: ANSI C78.20 means the ANSI standard ANSI C78.20-2003 entitled American National Standard for Electric Lamps — A, G, PS, and Similar Shapes with E26 Medium Screw Bases. (ANSI C78.20)
ANSI C79.1 means the ANSI standard ANSI C79.1-2002 entitled For Electric Lamps — Nomenclature for Glass Bulbs Intended for Use with Electric Lamps. (ANSI C79.1)
ANSI C81.61 means the ANSI standard ANSI-ANSLG C81.61-2009 entitled American National Standard for Electrical Lamp Bases — Specifications for Bases (Caps) for Electric Lamps. (ANSI C81.61)

appliance lamp means a lamp that is designed to operate in ambient temperatures of up to 315ºC, has a maximum nominal power of 40 W and is marketed as an appliance lamp. (lampe pour appareils électroménagers)
CIE 13.3 means the CIE standard CIE 13.3-1995 entitled Method of Measuring and Specifying Colour Rendering Properties of Light Sources. (CIE 13.3)
CIE 15 means the CIE standard CIE 15: 2004 entitled Colorimetry. (CIE 15)
coloured lamp means a lamp that is marketed as a coloured lamp and has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a colour rendering index of less than 50, as determined in accordance with CIE 13.3; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a correlated colour temperature of less than 2 500 K or more than 4 600 K. (lampe colorée)

Definition.Text: IES Handbook means the IES publication entitled Lighting Handbook, 9th edition. (Manuel IES)
IES LM16 means the IES standard IES LM-16-1993 entitled Practical Guide to Colorimetry of Light Sources. (IES LM16)
IES LM45 means the IES standard IES LM-45-09 entitled Approved Method for The Electrical and Photometric Measurement of General Service Incandescent Filament Lamps. (IES LM45)
IES LM49 means the IES standard IES LM-49-12 entitled Approved Method for Life Testing of Incandescent Filament Lamps. (IES LM49)
IES LM65 means the IES standard IES LM-65-10 entitled Approved Method for Life Testing of Compact Fluorescent Lamps. (IES LM65)
incandescent reflector lamp means a lamp in which light is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produced by a filament that is heated to incandescence by an electric current; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: directed by an inner reflective coating on the outer bulb. (lampe-réflecteur à incandescence)

Definition.Text: infrared lamp means a lamp that emits more than 90% of its radiation in the 0.7 µm to 10 µm range of the electromagnetic spectrum. (lampe infrarouge)
lamp efficacy means the number of lumens per watt determined by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dividing a lamp’s luminous flux by its power, measured under equilibrium conditions at the time of determining the luminous flux; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a general service incandescent reflector lamp, rounding the number calculated under paragraph (a) to the nearest half number. (efficacité lumineuse)

Definition.Text: modified spectrum lamp means a lamp, other than a coloured lamp, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is marketed as a modified spectrum lamp; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when operated at its nominal voltage and nominal power, has a colour point that, on the 1931 chromaticity diagram described in CIE 15, lies below the black-body locus and is at least 4 MacAdam steps, as described in IES LM16, distant from the colour point of a clear lamp with the same filament and bulb shape and that operates at the same nominal voltage and nominal power. (lampe à spectre modifié)

Definition.Text: plant lamp means a lamp that contains a filter or coating to suppress light with wavelengths of less than 0.58 µm and that is marketed as a plant lamp. (lampe pour horticulture)
rough service lamp means a lamp that is marketed as a rough service lamp and has any of the following filament constructions, as illustrated in figure 6.12 of the IES Handbook:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a C-7A or C-11 filament construction, with at least five supports exclusive of lead wires;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a C-17 filament construction, with eight supports exclusive of lead wires; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a C-22 filament construction, with 16 supports exclusive of lead wires. (lampe à construction renforcée)

Definition.Text: shatter-resistant lamp means a lamp that has an external silicone, polytetrafluoroethylene or similar coating applied to it for the purpose of resisting breakage and preventing glass from reaching the operating environment in the event of breakage and that is marketed as a shatter-resistant lamp. (lampe résistante à l’éclatement)

silver bowl lamp means a lamp that is marketed as a silver bowl lamp and that has a reflective coating that is applied directly to a part of the bulb surface so that light is reflected toward the lamp base. (lampe à calotte argentée)
submersible lamp means a lamp that meets the requirements set out in the CSA standard C22.2 No. 89-1976, entitled Swimming-Pool Luminaires, Submersible Luminaires and Accessories. (lampe submersible)
vibration service lamp means a lamp that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is marketed as a vibration service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a maximum nominal power of 60 W; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a C-5, C-7A or C-9 filament construction — as illustrated in figure 6.12 of the IES Handbook — or a similar construction, with less than five supports. (lampe antivibrations)

Section.Text: Every CFL, general service lamp, modified spectrum incandescent lamp and general service incandescent reflector lamp that, for the purpose of sale or lease, is shipped from one province to another or imported into Canada must be labelled in accordance with sections 426 to 429.

Subsection.Text: The principal display panel of the product’s package must display the following information in the following order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of a BR or ER lamp, the words “Light Output” and “Flux lumineux”, followed by the numerical value of the product’s luminous flux and the word “lumens”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Energy Used” and “Consommation d’énergie”, followed by the numerical value of the product’s nominal power and the word “watts”; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the words “Life” and “Durée de vie”, followed by the numerical value of the product’s life and the words “hours” and “heures”, respectively.

Subsection.Text: The words “Light Output”, “Flux lumineux”, “Energy Used”, “Consommation d’énergie”, “Life” and “Durée de vie” must be in the same font and be equal in size.
The words “lumens”, “watts”, “hours” and “heures” must be in the same font and be equal in size, but they must not be more than 50% of the size of the words referred to in subsection (2).
The numerical values indicating the product’s luminous flux, nominal power and life must be in the same font and be equal in size.
If the product is a three-way lamp, the information required by paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) must be displayed for each level of the lamp’s operation.

Section.Text: Despite paragraph 426(1)(c), the value that is displayed on the principal display panel for the life of a CFL may be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the life testing of the CFL is completed, a value that is less than its life; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the life testing of the CFL is not completed, its design life, if a laboratory accredited in respect of the energy performance of lighting products by either the Standards Council of Canada or the National Voluntary Laboratory Accreditation Program, an A2LA certified laboratory or an ISO 9000 certified laboratory or manufacturing facility has, in accordance with IES LM65, verified 40% of the design life and at that point in the testing not more than one unit in the test sample has failed.

Subsection.Text: If the design voltage of the product is other than 120 V, the information required by section 426 may correspond to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a voltage of 120 V, followed by the words “at 120 volts” and “à 120 volts”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the design voltage, followed by the words, “at [design voltage] volts” and “à [tension spécifique]”.

Subsection.Text: If the information corresponds to the design voltage,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following statement must be displayed on the principal display panel:

Provision.Text: “This product is designed for [design voltage] volts. When used on the normal line voltage of 120 volts, the light output and energy efficiency are noticeably reduced. See [appropriate panel] panel for 120-volt rating.”

« Ce produit a été conçu en fonction d’une tension de [tension spécifique] volts. S’il est employé à la tension normale de 120 volts, son flux lumineux et sa consommation d’énergie s’en trouveront considérablement réduits. Voir le panneau [panneau en cause] pour les renseignements correspondant à une tension de 120 volts. »;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information required by section 426 for the product corresponding to a voltage of 120 V, followed by the words “at 120 volts” and “à 120 volts”, must be displayed on a panel of the product’s package other than the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the design voltage must be displayed on every panel that displays the information required by section 426, other than the panel on which the information required by paragraph (b) is displayed.

Section.Text: If more than one type of lamp is included in a common package and their characteristics are not uniform, the principal display panel of the common package must display the following information for each type of lamp:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its design voltage; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information required by section 426, which must be in the size and font specified in that section.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CFL means an integrally ballasted compact fluorescent lamp that has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a medium screw base; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a nominal voltage of at least 100 V but not more than 130 V or a nominal voltage range that lies at least partially between those voltages. (LFC)

Definition.Text: CSA C861 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C861-10 entitled Performance of Self-ballasted Compact Fluorescent Lamps and Ballasted Adapters. (CSA C861)

Subsection.Text: A CFL is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 432, a CFL is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after June 1, 2009.
For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a CFL:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal voltage;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts, or if it is a three-way lamp, its nominal power, expressed in watts, at each operating level;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its luminous flux, or if it is a three-way lamp, its luminous flux at each operating level;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lamp efficacy;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its life, expressed in hours; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its correlated colour temperature.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) and (f) must be collected in accordance with CSA C861; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraph (1)(e) must, using a sample of 10 CFLs, be collected in accordance with IES LM65, except that if the manufacturer has not specified an operating orientation for the lamp or has specified more than one orientation, five of the CFLs must be tested in the base-up orientation and the other five must be tested in the base-down orientation.

Subsection.Text: In this Subdivision, general service lamp means an electrical device that provides functional illumination and has a luminous flux of at least 310 lm but not more than 2 600 lm, a nominal voltage of at least 110 V but not more than 130 V or a nominal voltage range that lies at least partially between those voltages and a screw base. It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an appliance lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a CFL;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a coloured lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an infrared lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a G-shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a diameter of 12.7 cm or more;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a T-shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a maximum nominal power of 40 W or a length of more than 25.4 cm or both;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a left-hand thread lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a plant lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: an incandescent reflector lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a vacuum type or gas-filled lamp that has a sufficiently low bulb temperature to permit exposed outdoor use on high-speed flashing circuits and that is marketed as a sign service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a silver bowl lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a traffic signal module, a pedestrian module or a street light;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a submersible lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a screw base size of E5, E10, E11, E12, E17, E26/50×39, E26/53×39, E29/28, E29/53×39, E39, E39d, EP39 or EX39 as specified in ANSI C81.61;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a B, BA, CA, F, G16-½, G25, G30, S or M-14 shape or other similar shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a maximum nominal power of 40 W;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that emits visible light produced by a current passing through a p-n junction solid state device; or

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: a modified spectrum lamp.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the luminous flux of a general service lamp must be calculated in accordance with IES LM45, except that the lamp must be tested at 120 V regardless of its nominal voltage.
A general service lamp is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a general service lamp is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 435,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a rough service lamp, a vibration service lamp, a shatter-resistant lamp or a lamp with an E26d screw base,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it has a luminous flux of less than 1 050 lm and was manufactured before December 31, 2014, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it has a luminous flux of at least 1 050 lm and was manufactured before January 1, 2014; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 425 to 429, if it was manufactured before September 1, 2008.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to general service lamps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A general service lamp complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures that are applicable to a general service lamp as defined in section 433 and set out in the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: IES LM45 for the nominal power;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: IES LM49 for the life of the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: CIE 13.3 for the colour rendering index.

Subsection.Text: The testing referred to in subsection (2) must, despite any provision to the contrary in the identified standard, be conducted with the lamp operating at 120 V regardless of its nominal voltage.

row.entry: General service lamps that have a luminous flux of < 750 lm
General service lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 750 lm and < 1 050 lm
General service lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 1 050 lm and < 1 490 lm
General service lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 1 490 lm

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a general service lamp:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the lamp, collected in accordance with ANSI C79.1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its colour rendering index, collected in accordance with CIE 13.3;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its correlated colour temperature, collected in accordance with CIE 15;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the following information collected in accordance with IES LM45, with the testing procedure adjusted in accordance with subsection 435(3), namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts, or if it is a three-way lamp, its nominal power, expressed in watts, at each operating level, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its luminous flux, expressed in lumens, or if it is a three-way lamp, its luminous flux, expressed in lumens, at each operating level; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its life, expressed in hours, collected in accordance with IES LM49, with the testing procedure adjusted in accordance with subsection 435(3).

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of modified spectrum incandescent lamp

Subsection.Text: In this Subdivision, modified spectrum incandescent lamp means a modified spectrum lamp that has a luminous flux of at least 232 lm but not more than 1 950 lm, a nominal voltage of at least 110 V but not more than 130 V or a nominal voltage range that lies at least partially between those voltages, and a screw base. It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an appliance lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a CFL;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an infrared lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a G-shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a diameter of 12.7 cm or more;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a T-shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a maximum nominal power of 40 W or a length of more than 25.4 cm or both;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that uses solid state technology, namely, a lamp with a light source that comes from light-emitting diodes;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a left-hand thread lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a plant lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: an incandescent reflector lamp that has a shape specified in ANSI C79.1;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a vacuum type or gas-filled lamp that has a sufficiently low bulb temperature to permit exposed outdoor use on high-speed flashing circuits and that is marketed as a sign service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a silver bowl lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a traffic signal module, a pedestrian module or a street light;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a submersible lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a screw base size of E5, E10, E11, E12, E17, E26/50×39, E26/53×39, E29/28, E29/53×39, E39, E39d, EP39 or EX39 as specified in ANSI C81.61; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that has a B, BA, CA, F, G16-½, G25, G30, S or M-14 shape or other similar shape as specified in ANSI C78.20 and ANSI C79.1 and a maximum nominal power of 40 W.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of these Regulations, the luminous flux of a modified spectrum incandescent lamp must be calculated in accordance with IES LM45, except that the lamp must be tested at 120 V regardless of its nominal voltage.
A modified spectrum incandescent lamp is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a modified spectrum incandescent lamp is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 439,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a rough service lamp, a vibration service lamp, a shatter-resistant lamp or a lamp with an E26d screw base,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it has a luminous flux of at least 788 lm and was manufactured before January 1, 2014, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it has a luminous flux of less than 788 lm and was manufactured before December 31, 2014; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 5 and 425 to 429, if it was manufactured before September 1, 2008.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to modified spectrum incandescent lamps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A modified spectrum incandescent lamp complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures that are applicable to a modified spectrum incandescent lamp as defined in section 437 and set out in the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: IES LM45 for the nominal power;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: IES LM49 for the life of the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: CIE 13.3 for the colour rendering index.

Subsection.Text: The testing referred to in subsection (2) must, despite any provision to the contrary in the identified standard, be conducted with the lamp operating at 120 V regardless of its nominal voltage.

row.entry: Modified spectrum incandescent lamps that have a luminous flux of < 563 lm
Modified spectrum incandescent lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 563 lm and < 788 lm
Modified spectrum incandescent lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 788 lm and < 1 118 lm
Modified spectrum incandescent lamps that have a luminous flux of ≥ 1 118 lm

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a modified spectrum incandescent lamp:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the lamp, collected in accordance with ANSI C79.1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its colour rendering index, collected in accordance with CIE 13.3;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its correlated colour temperature, collected in accordance with CIE 15;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the following information collected in accordance with IES LM45, with the testing procedure adjusted in accordance with subsection 439(3), namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts, or if it is a three-way lamp, its nominal power, expressed in watts, at each operating level, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its luminous flux, expressed in lumens, or if it is a three-way lamp, its luminous flux, expressed in lumens, at each operating level; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its life, expressed in hours, collected in accordance with IES LM49, with the testing procedure adjusted in accordance with subsection 439(3).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C862-01 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C862-01 entitled Performance of Incandescent Reflector Lamps. (CSA C862-01)
CSA C862-09 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C862-09 entitled Performance of Incandescent Reflector Lamps. (CSA C862-09)
CSA C862-12 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C862-12 entitled Performance of Incandescent Reflector Lamps. (CSA C862-12)

general service incandescent reflector lamp means an incandescent reflector lamp that has a bulb shape described in ANSI C79.1 or a bulb shape similar to that shape, and that has an E26/24 single contact or E26/50×39 skirted medium screw base, a nominal voltage of at least 100 V but not more than 130 V or a nominal voltage range that lies at least partially between those voltages, a diameter of more than 57 mm and a nominal power of at least 40 W but not more than 205 W. It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a coloured lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a rough service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a vibration service lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a silver bowl lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an infrared lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a lamp that is marketed for heat sensitive applications or for mine, terrarium, vivarium, airfield, aircraft or automotive use;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a BR30 or BR40 lamp, that has a nominal power of 50 W or less or of 65 W;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an R20 lamp that has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a nominal power of 45 W or less, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a nominal power of 100 W, a nominal overall length of not more than 92 mm (3.625 inches) and that is designed and marketed for pool and spa applications; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a modified spectrum lamp that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is an ER30 or ER40 lamp, that has a nominal power of 50 W or less,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is an ER40 lamp that has a nominal power of 65 W, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: was manufactured before July 15, 2012. (lampe-réflecteur à incandescence standard)

Subsection.Text: A general service incandescent reflector lamp is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a general service incandescent reflector lamp is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 4, if it was manufactured before December 31, 1996; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 425 to 429, if it was manufactured before September 1, 2008.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to general service incandescent reflector lamps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A general service incandescent reflector lamp complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C862-12 that are applicable to a general service incandescent reflector lamp as defined in section 441.

row.entry: General service incandescent reflector lamps that are ER30 or ER40 lamps with a nominal power of 50 W
General service incandescent reflector lamps that are ER30 or ER40 lamps with a nominal power of < 50 W
General service incandescent reflector lamps that are ER40 lamps with a nominal power of 65 W
General service incandescent reflector lamps, other than ER30 or ER40 lamps with a nominal power of ≤ 50 W and ER40 lamps with a nominal power of 65 W
On or after June 1, 2009 and before July 15, 2012
General service incandescent reflector lamps, other than ER30 or ER40 lamps with a nominal power of ≤ 50 W and ER40 lamps with a nominal power of 65 W

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a general service incandescent reflector lamp described in column 1.

row.entry: General service incandescent reflector lamps manufactured before June 1, 2009
General service incandescent reflector lamps manufactured on or after June 1, 2009

Provision.Text: CSA C862-12 for information set out in paragraphs (a) to (g)
CIE 15 for correlated colour temperature in paragraph (h)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: average lamp efficacy at nominal voltage and at 120 V;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: luminous flux, rounded to nearest tenth, at nominal voltage and at 120 V;

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: if applicable, identification of lamp as a modified spectrum lamp.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: 10 C.F.R. Appendix R means Appendix R to Subpart B, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, entitled Uniform Test Method for Measuring Average Lamp Efficacy (LE), Color Rendering Index (CRI), and Correlated Color Temperature (CCT) of Electric Lamps, as amended from time to time. (appendice R 10 C.F.R.)

10 C.F.R. §430.32(n)(4) means the table to paragraph 430.32(n)(4) of Subpart C, Part 430 of Title 10 to the United States Code of Federal Regulations, as amended from time to time. (10 C.F.R. §430.32(n)(4))
ANSI C78.81 means the ANSI standard ANSI C78.81-2010 entitled American National Standard for Electric Lamps Double-Capped Fluorescent Lamps — Dimensional and Electrical Characteristics. (ANSI C78.81)

ANSI C78.901 means the ANSI standard ANSI C78.901-2005 entitled American National Standard for Electric Lamps Single — Based Fluorescent Lamps — Dimensional and Electrical Characteristics. (ANSI C78.901)
CSA C819-11 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C819-11 entitled Performance of General Service Fluorescent Lamps. (CSA C819-11)
CSA C819-16 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C819-16 entitled Performance of General Service Fluorescent Lamps. (CSA C819-16)
CSA C819-95 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C819-95 entitled Performance of General Service Fluorescent Lamps. (CSA C819-95)

cold temperature fluorescent lamp means a fluorescent lamp that is marketed for outdoor or cold temperature use and that is designed to start at temperatures as low as –29°C (–20°F) when used with a ballast that conforms to the requirements of ANSI C78.81 and ANSI C78.901. (lampe fluorescente pour basses températures)
coloured fluorescent lamp means a fluorescent lamp that has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a colour rendering index of less than 40, as determined in accordance with CIE 13.3; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a correlated colour temperature of less than 2 500 K or more than 7 000 K, as determined in accordance with the IES standard IES LM-9-09 entitled Approved Method for the Electrical and Photometric Measurements of Fluorescent Lamps. (lampe fluorescente colorée)

Definition.Text: general service fluorescent lamp means a fluorescent lamp that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is straight-shaped and has a nominal overall length of 1 200 mm (48 inches), a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of at least 25 W;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is U-shaped and has a nominal overall length of at least 560 mm (22 inches) but not more than 635 mm (25 inches), a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of at least 25 W;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is rapid-start and straight-shaped and has a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm (96 inches) and a recessed double-contact base;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is instant-start and straight-shaped and has a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm (96 inches), a single-pin base and a nominal power of at least 52 W;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is straight-shaped and standard output and has a nominal overall length of at least 1 125 mm (45 inches) but not more than 1 200 mm (48 inches), a miniature bi-pin base and a nominal power of at least 26 W;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is straight-shaped and high output with a nominal overall length of at least 1 125 mm (45 inches) but not more than 1 200 mm (48 inches), a miniature bi-pin base and a nominal power of at least 49 W; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: is a physical and electrical equivalent of a lamp described in any of paragraphs (a) to (f).

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp that is marketed as a plant lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a cold temperature fluorescent lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a coloured fluorescent lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp that is designed to be impact-resistant;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a reflectorized or aperture fluorescent lamp;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp that is designed for use in reprographic equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp that is primarily designed to produce ultraviolet radiation; or

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: a fluorescent lamp that has a colour-rendering index of at least 87. (lampe fluorescente standard)

Subsection.Text: A general service fluorescent lamp is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purpose of section 4, a general service fluorescent lamp is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after December 31, 1996.

The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to general service fluorescent lamps described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 4.

A general service fluorescent lamp complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a general service fluorescent lamp as defined in section 445.

row.entry: General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 1 200 mm, a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of > 35 W
General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 1 200 mm, a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of ≤ 35 W

General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm, a recessed double-contact base, a nominal power of > 100 W and a nominal current of 0.8 A

General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm, a recessed double-contact base, a nominal power of ≤ 100 W and a nominal current of 0.8 A
General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and U-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of ≥ 560 mm but ≤ 635 mm, a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of > 35 W
General service fluorescent lamps that are rapid-start and U-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of ≥ 560 mm but ≤ 635 mm, a medium bi-pin base and a nominal power of ≤ 35 W
General service fluorescent lamps that are instant-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm, a single-pin base and a nominal power of > 65 W
General service fluorescent lamps that are instant-start and straight-shaped and that have a nominal overall length of 2 400 mm, a single-pin base and a nominal power of ≤ 65 W
On or after July 15, 2012 and before January 26, 2018
CSA C819-16 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix R
CSA C819-16, Table 1 or average lamp efficacy × 1.011 > the minimum average lamp efficacy for the product in 10 C.F.R. §430.32(n)(4)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a general service fluorescent lamp:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its shape;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal overall length;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its diameter;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its base type;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its abbreviation under the designation system in ANSI C78.81, Annex A, and ANSI C78.901, Annex B;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: its correlated colour temperature;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: its average colour-rendering index; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the average lamp efficacy.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with one of the following standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C819-95, if the product was manufactured before July 15, 2012;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C819-11, if the product is manufactured on or after July 15, 2012 and before January 26, 2018; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: CSA C819-16 or 10 C.F.R. Appendix R, if the product is manufactured on or after January 26, 2018.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C654-10 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-654-10 entitled Fluorescent Lamp Ballast Efficacy Measurements. (CSA C654-10)
CSA C654-14 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-654-14 entitled Fluorescent Lamp Ballast Efficacy Measurements. (CSA C654-14)
fluorescent lamp ballast means a device that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designed to start and operate fluorescent lamps by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: providing the necessary voltage and current,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: limiting the current during normal operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if necessary to facilitate lamp operation, providing cathode heating;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designed for input of 120 V, 277 V or 347 V; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: designed to operate an F32T8, F34T12, F40T10 or F40T12 rapid-start fluorescent lamp or an F96T12ES, F96T12IS, F96T12HO or F96T12HO ES fluorescent lamp.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: It does not include any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a ballast that is designed to be used in an outdoor sign and to operate two F96T12HO fluorescent lamps in ambient temperatures at or below –28.9°C;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a ballast that, by means of an integrated dimming capability, can reduce the output of the fluorescent lamp by 50% or more;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a low-frequency T8 ballast that is designed and marketed only for use in an electromagnetic-interference-sensitive environment and that is sold in a package of 10 or fewer; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a program-start ballast that is designed to operate one or more T8 fluorescent lamps with a nominal overall length of 1 200 mm and a medium bi-pin base, and that delivers an average current of less than 140 mA to each lamp. (ballast pour lampes fluorescentes)

Subsection.Text: A fluorescent lamp ballast is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 451, a fluorescent lamp ballast is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after February 3, 1995.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to fluorescent lamp ballasts that are manufactured during the periods described in column 3.

A fluorescent lamp ballast complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by the standard set out in column 1 that are applicable to a fluorescent lamp ballast as defined in section 449.

Provision.Text: CSA C654-10, clause 4 for power factor
CSA C654-10, Table 2 for ballast efficacy factor

row.entry: On or after February 3, 1995 and before November 14, 2014

Provision.Text: CSA C654-14, clause 4 for power factor
CSA C654-14, clause 5.2 for ballast luminous efficiency

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the information set out in column 3 of the table to this section must be collected in accordance with the standard set out in column 2 and provided to the Minister in respect of a fluorescent lamp ballast described in column 1.

row.entry: Fluorescent lamp ballasts manufactured on or after February 3, 1995 and before November 14, 2014

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: type and number of fluorescent lamps it is designed to operate; and

row.entry: Fluorescent lamp ballasts manufactured on or after November 14, 2014

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: class number set out in Table 1A of CSA C654-14;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: total lamp arc power, in watts; and

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 means the CSA standard C22.2 No. 250.0-08 entitled Luminaires. (CSA C22.2 No. 250.0)

ITE VTCSH means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Vehicle Traffic Control Signal Heads: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Circular Signal Supplement, dated June 27, 2005. (ITE VTCSH)

pin-based means, with respect to a socket of a ceiling fan or ceiling fan light kit, one that is designed to hold a fluorescent lamp that is not integrally ballasted and that has a plug-in lamp base. It does not include a GU-24 socket. (à broche)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 means the CSA standard C22.2 No. 250.4-14 entitled Portable luminaires. (CSA C22.2 No. 250.4)

torchiere means a portable luminaire that has a reflector bowl or similar-shaped reflector that directs light in a predominantly upward direction for the purpose of providing indirect lighting and that may be equipped with one or more additional sockets intended for other lighting functions. (torchère)

Subsection.Text: A torchiere is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 509, a torchiere is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to torchieres described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A torchiere complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 that are applicable to a torchiere as defined in section 507.

row.entry: Torchieres that have no additional sockets
On or after January 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2010
Torchieres that have no additional sockets
Torchieres that have one or more additional sockets
On or after January 1, 2007 and before January 1, 2010
Torchieres that have one or more additional sockets

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C22.2 No. 250.4 and provided to the Minister in respect of a torchiere:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information that indicates whether the product has lighting functions additional to those of the bowl; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total power, expressed in watts, for all lighting functions.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, ceiling fan means a household ceiling fan that has integrated lighting.

Subsection.Text: A ceiling fan is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a ceiling fan is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 513, unless it has a total power of more than 10 W, has at least one socket that is not pin-based and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standard that applies to a ceiling fan described in paragraph 512(2)(b) is that the total power for the integrated lighting must be less than or equal to 190 W.

A ceiling fan complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 that are applicable to a ceiling fan as defined in section 511.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 and provided to the Minister in respect of a ceiling fan:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the type of sockets for the integrated lighting; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total power, expressed in watts, for the integrated lighting.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of ceiling fan light kit
Section.Text: In this Subdivision, ceiling fan light kit means equipment that is designed to be attached to a ceiling fan for the purpose of providing light.

Subsection.Text: A ceiling fan light kit is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, a ceiling fan light kit is not considered to be an energy-using product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of sections 4 and 5, unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purpose of section 517, unless it has at least one socket that is not pin-based and is manufactured on or after January 1, 2010.

Subsection.Text: The energy efficiency standard that applies to a ceiling fan light kit described in paragraph 516(2)(b) is that the total power for the product must be less than or equal to 190 W.

A ceiling fan light kit complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 that are applicable to a ceiling fan light kit as defined in section 515.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C22.2 No. 250.0 and provided to the Minister in respect of a ceiling fan light kit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its socket type; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its total power, expressed in watts.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: CSA C860 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA C860-11 entitled Performance of Internally Lighted Exit Signs. (CSA C860)
exit sign has the same meaning as in CSA C860. It does not include an exit sign that flashes or that is photoluminescent or radioluminescent. (enseigne de sortie)
legend means any of the following that is displayed on an exit sign:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a representation of a running person, as described in Annex B.1 of CSA C22.2 No. 141; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the word “EXIT” or “SORTIE”. (légende)

Subsection.Text: An exit sign is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purpose of section 4, an exit sign is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after November 1, 2004.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to exit signs described in column 1.

An exit sign complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C860 that are applicable to an exit sign as defined in section 519.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with CSA C860 and provided to the Minister in respect of an exit sign:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its power consumption, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of legends.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: traffic signal module means a self-contained device that is designed to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fit into a traffic signal housing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide drivers with movement information by means of a red or green traffic signal indicator that is 203.2 mm or 304.8 mm in diameter. (module de signalisation routière)

Definition.Text: VTCSH Arrow means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Vehicle Traffic Control Signal Heads: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Vehicle Arrow Traffic Signal Supplement, dated July 1, 2007. (VTCSH Arrow)

VTCSH Circular means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Vehicle Traffic Control Signal Heads: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Circular Signal Supplement, dated June 27, 2005. (VTCSH Circular)

Subsection.Text: A traffic signal module is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 525, a traffic signal module is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 3 of the table to this section apply to traffic signal modules described in column 1.
For the purpose of subsection (1), the maximum power and nominal power of a traffic signal module must be determined in accordance with the following procedures:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the luminous intensity of the product must be determined in accordance with the procedures established by the standard set out in column 2 that are applicable to a traffic signal module as defined in section 523;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s power must be measured using a watt meter that has an accuracy of ± 1%;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s maximum power, the product must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: mounted in a temperature testing chamber with the lens portion of the product outside the chamber, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at a temperature of 74°C and with the temperature in front of the lens maintained at a minimum of 49°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s nominal power, the product must be operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at an ambient temperature of 25°C.

row.entry: Traffic signal modules that have a red light traffic signal indicator that is 203.2 mm in diameter
Traffic signal modules that have a red light traffic signal indicator that is 304.8 mm in diameter
Traffic signal modules that have a green light traffic signal indicator that is 203.2 mm in diameter
Traffic signal modules that have a green light traffic signal indicator that is 304.8 mm in diameter
Traffic signal modules that have a red arrow traffic signal indicator
Traffic signal modules that have a green arrow traffic signal indicator

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be provided to the Minister in respect of a traffic signal module:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum power, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts.

Subsection.Text: The information must be collected in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: VTCSH Arrow, if the traffic signal module has an arrow traffic signal indicator; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: VTCSH Circular, if the traffic signal module has any other traffic signal indicator.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: pedestrian module means a self-contained device that is designed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to fit into a pedestrian signal housing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to provide pedestrians with movement information by means of a walking person display or a hand display but not by means of a countdown message. (module de signalisation piétonnière)

Definition.Text: PTCSI means the Institute of Transportation Engineers standard entitled Pedestrian Traffic Control Signal Indicators: Light Emitting Diode (LED) Signal Modules, dated August 4, 2010. (PTCSI)

Subsection.Text: A pedestrian module is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 529, a pedestrian module is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after January 1, 2007.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to pedestrian modules described in column 1.
For the purpose of subsection (1), the maximum power and nominal power of a pedestrian module must be determined in accordance with the following procedures:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the luminous intensity of the product must be determined in accordance with the procedures established by PTCSI that are applicable to a pedestrian module as defined in section 527;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the product’s power must be measured using a watt meter that has an accuracy of ± 1%;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s maximum power, the product must be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: mounted in a temperature testing chamber with the lens portion of the product outside the chamber, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at a temperature of 74°C and with the temperature in front of the lens maintained at a minimum temperature of 49°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: when determining the product’s nominal power, the product must be operated for a minimum of 60 minutes at an ambient temperature of 25°C.

row.entry: Pedestrian modules that have a walking person display and a hand display
Pedestrian modules that have a walking person display only
Pedestrian modules that have a hand display only

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 5(1) of the Act, the following information must be collected in accordance with PTCSI and provided to the Minister in respect of a pedestrian module:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its maximum power, expressed in watts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its nominal power, expressed in watts.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: CSA C62301 means the CSA standard CAN/CSA-C62301:11 entitled Household Electrical Appliances – Measurement of Standby Power. (CSA C62301)
information display means a clock or other device that provides visual alphanumeric or graphical information or indicates the status of the equipment. (affichage)

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Subdivision.

Definition.Text: compact audio product means a product that consists of an amplifier and a terrestrial tuner that are encased in a single housing — including a product that can produce sound from another media — and that uses mains power as at least one source of power and has attached or separable speakers. (produit audio compact)

off mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power, cannot produce sound or provide any mechanical function and cannot be switched into another mode except by means of a manual switch on the product. (mode arrêt)

standby mode means the mode in which the product, while connected to mains power, cannot produce sound or provide any mechanical function, but can be switched into another mode with a remote control unit, an internal signal or an internal timer. (mode veille)

Subsection.Text: A compact audio product is prescribed as an energy-using product.
However, for the purposes of sections 4, 5 and 576, a compact audio product is not considered to be an energy-using product unless it is manufactured on or after May 1, 2011.
The energy efficiency standards set out in column 2 of the table to this section apply to compact audio products described in column 1 that are manufactured during the periods set out in column 3.

A compact audio product complies with the energy efficiency standard if it meets that standard when tested in accordance with testing procedures established by CSA C62301 that are applicable to a compact audio product as defined in section 574.

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

row.entry: On or after May 1, 2011 and before January 1, 2013
Compact audio products, other than clock radios

Provision.Text: Must be capable of entering standby mode or off mode.
Power consumption of product must be, as applicable,

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: ≤ 1 W in standby mode with information display active;

Provision.Label: (b)
